page.title: 07Crowcombe Court
page.content: Crowcombe Court is to the north west of the church and the court and gardens were liad out in 1676 by {John {Carew.}The building was designed by { {Thomas Parker}to Gittisham, Devon and built with brick. Crowcombe Court was first lived in about 1725 but the roof was not put on untill 1727. The house is thought to be the best example of its type in the country south of Bath. Thomas Carew sold six manors to pay for the house, and spent{Â£4,122 } on the work up to 1734.{Nathaniel {lreson }of Wincanton was the architect who started work in 1734 to complete the house. It was finally finished in 1739. The building is 250 metres from where the old manor house was. The old manor house was mentioned in 1295 but was demolished in 1724.
